learning_outcomes.description: Define the pathways by which microorganisms cause the major diseases encountered in dental clinical practice.
Appraise the various methods used to contain infection and prevent its spread, at the level of the site and the patient.
Explain the various host immune responses.
Explain the aetiology and epidemiology of major dental diseases.
Apply understanding of host responses to common dental diseases and conditions.

assessments.task_description:
For this assessment, you are required to develop a recorded digital presentation that examines a clinical setting of your choice. In your presentation, you should clearly illustrate how this environment may create potential pathways for microorganisms to be transmitted and contribute to disease development in patients.

You must also provide a detailed description and critical evaluation of the infection prevention and control measures implemented at the site level. This should include an analysis of how these strategies reduce the risk of cross-contamination and limit the spread of infectious agents within the clinical environment.

Your discussion should demonstrate an understanding of microbiological risks in healthcare settings and the practical application of infection control principles to protect both patients and healthcare personnel.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: For this task, you are required to write a literature review examining host immune responses to a common dental disease of your choice. Your review should synthesise current evidence on the key immune cells, mediators, and pathways involved in disease initiation and progression, and critically evaluate how these responses contribute to tissue damage and/or protection. Where relevant, discuss clinical implications, including how immune mechanisms inform prevention, diagnosis, or treatment strategies.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The end-of-semester exam will be conducted in person via Inspera during the Central Examination Period. This is a must-pass assessment item, requiring a minimum mark of 60% to pass. The exam duration is 120 minutes and will include multiple-choice, multiple-response, and short-answer questions. Content may be drawn from, but is not limited to, lecture slides, tutorial materials, and Blackboard resources. This assessment is designed to evaluate students’ breadth and depth of learning, including both theoretical understanding and applied practical knowledge developed throughout the Semester 1 course.

To participate, students must have a laptop with the Inspera safe browser installed. It is recommended to arrive 10 minutes early for ID verification and to set up the locked browser on their computers. Students should ensure their laptops are fully charged and bring a charger.

For those without a laptop and internet access (connect to Eduroam), the option to borrow a laptop from the Library may be available (https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/laptop-loans).

Once the exam commences, access will be restricted to the Inspera test browser, and communication via email on the device used for the exam will not be possible.

To minimise disruptions, students are advised to turn off phones and other devices (including wearables and tablets), either store them in lockers and bags, or place them face down on the floor.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
